title: News regarding YummyFoods
story_body:
YummyFoods Appoints New VP of Supply Chain Operations

YummyFoods Corporation (NYSE: YUM) announced today the appointment of Maria Chen as Vice President of Supply Chain Operations, effective January 15. Chen will oversee the company's North American distribution network and report directly to Chief Operating Officer David Martinez.

Chen joins YummyFoods from PepsiCo, where she spent 12 years in various supply chain leadership roles, most recently serving as Senior Director of Logistics. She holds an MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management and a bachelor's degree in industrial engineering from Purdue University.

"Maria brings extensive experience in optimizing complex distribution systems and implementing cost-effective logistics solutions," said Martinez in a company statement. "Her expertise will be valuable as we continue to enhance our operational efficiency."

In her new role, Chen will be responsible for managing relationships with third-party logistics providers, overseeing inventory management systems, and leading a team of approximately 200 employees across YummyFoods' distribution centers.

The appointment comes as YummyFoods continues its steady expansion in the packaged foods sector. The company operates 15 distribution facilities across North America and supplies products to over 50,000 retail locations.

Chen replaces Robert Thompson, who announced his retirement last October after 25 years with the company. Thompson will remain with YummyFoods through the end of February to ensure a smooth transition.

YummyFoods also announced that several members of its executive team will attend the upcoming Food Industry Leadership Summit in Chicago next month. Chief Marketing Officer Lisa Park is scheduled to participate in a panel discussion on consumer trends in the snack food category.

The company's stock closed at $67.42 yesterday, up 0.3% for the day. YummyFoods maintains its full-year revenue guidance of $4.2 to $4.4 billion and expects to release fourth-quarter earnings on February 22.

Founded in 1985, YummyFoods manufactures and distributes a portfolio of snack foods, frozen meals, and beverage products. The company employs approximately 12,000 people globally and is headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota.
